content.description: Sit start with a left hand incut sidepull and a right hand sidepull on the the large shelf-arete. From there, pull up and press a knee on the arete, slap a right hand further along the arete, then reach the shelf with the left hand, finish up the remainder, and complete an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. It has a great landing though.
content.location: It climbs the west side of Jenga's southwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with a good right hand edge and a left hand palming the face. From there, reach out left to an undercling, walk the feet over, gain a left hand edge, follow to a right hand edge, then continue up the remaining jugs to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. There is a very good landing for this problem.
content.location: It climbs the south side of Jenga's southwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand on the arete. From there, bump up the arete to an edge, match on some bumps near the arete, gain a jug below the lip, use the bumps, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is good, but there is a nasty rock directly behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the south side of Jenga's southeast arete.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the large nose. From there, follow the jug-rail to the right until reaching the southwest arete, then climb straight up to an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing has a rock at the start, but it's an otherwise great landing.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Jenga.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the good rail. From there, climb straight up through a pair of sloping edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing has a rock that makes it slightly uneven.
content.location: It climbs the center of Jenga's west face.
